channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #217 - YAPC::EU keynote videos
item.description:
The videos for all of the YAPC::EU keynotes are now available on youtube, and a bunch of other videos turned up as well. You should watch Sawyer's and Ovid's talks, but my favourite was Xavier Noria's Homage to Perl.

After a prolonged outage, CPAN Testers is back in action, and Barbie introduced the next Dread Pirate Roberts.

Do you like getting non-Perl links, or would you prefer to keep things Perl-only here?

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Perl Dancer book available
item.description: All the Perl Maven articles related to Perl Dancer, now bundled in one e-book available. There is a button at the bottom of the page where you can purchase the book.

item.title: CPAN Testers Is Back
item.description: CPAN Testers is one of those things that you only truly appreciate the value of when it goes away for a time. Like many CPAN authors, I'm very glad it's back!

item.title: Introducing Doug Bell
item.description: Barbie introduces Doug Bell (PREACTION), who not only helped with the recent rebuilding of CPAN Testers, but is going to be taking on Barbie' mantle.

item.title: Strawberry Perl 5.20.3.1 released
item.description: Recently Perl 5.20.3 was released, and now the Strawberry Perl port of that for Windows is available.

item.title: cperl-5.22.1 released
item.description: Reini has announced a release of cperl, which is a fork of the current stable Perl 5 release. You can read about the differences between Perl 5 and cperl here.

item.title: Community Heroes: Liz and Wendy
item.description: If you've been to a Perl conference or workshop you've probably come across Liz and Wendy. Mark sings their praises.

item.title: Ressurrecting Perl.pt
item.description: Prompted by YAPC::EU, the Portuguese Perl Mongers now have a new web site, which is generated by Perl 6.

item.title: Testing with a real database
item.description: Jan presents his new DBIx::TempDB module, which helps with testing your DB code with a temporary database.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: A Date with CPAN, Part 1: State of the Union
item.description: You've no doubt all seen that quotation, about the three hard things in computer science: naming, cache invalidation, and date/time processing? Buddy lists everything he wants from a module for processing dates, and then rates the leading CPAN modules against his requirements. He finds them all lacking in one way another, and tells us that his next blog post will be his thoughts on how we can improve things. This feels like the start of a horror movie: "don't open that door Buddy!"

item.title: Travis-CI and latest version of Perl 5
item.description: Gabor asked how you can get Travis CI to test with Perl 5.22 and blead. One of the comments directed him to HAARG's Travis helpers, which is the reason why I included this post. Let Graham (HAARG) know if you'd like to see a "latest stable perl" capability in the helpers.

item.title: Using pmless and pmdoc
item.description: pmless is a script for paging through the source of a module, and pmman does the same for a module's documentation.

item.title: This Is The NeoVim Way To Go, This Is The Way Of The Futures
item.description: There are some weeks when I really suspect that Yanick has been snorting the orchid pollen. You'll have to decide for yourself if this is one of those weeks. (It's ok, Yanick's a friend, and a co-editor, so I have special dispensation to say things like this about him).

item.title: The Joy of Prefetch
item.description: Dave built a web app using Dancer2 and DBIx::Class, but found that it was running an awful lot of queries. He shares the secret of prefetch, which took one page from 120 queries down to 3.

item.title: Improved DBIx::Class usage with arbitrary SQL
item.description: Ovid's DBIx::Class::Report module makes it easy to run ad-hoc SQL queries in your DBIx::Class code, and now he's added the capability to define additional methods on each result.

item.title: State of the (Art) Velociraptor
item.description: Sawyer's thoughts on the state of the Perl 5 community, after taking over from Matt. He ruminates on the definition of community and what sub-communities make up "the Perl 5 community". He ends with his proposed definition for what "community" is really about, and asks us all to think about how to grow our community. One line really resonated with me: "I know that perl fits in my head, and that's why I use it". Duration: 44 minutes.

item.title: Xavier Noria: Homage to Perl
item.description: Xavier presents his perspective on Perl and the Perl culture, as someone who used to consider himself a Perl programmer, but is now a Ruby programmer. He makes lots of great observations, and will leave you feeling better about Perl. My favourite point: he loves the SYNOPSIS section in CPAN documentation. Duration: 48 minutes

item.title: Turning points
item.description: Ovid talks about past turning points in the history of Perl, and the one approaching, when Perl 6 is released. He argues that we should see this as an opportunity to promote both Perl 5 and Perl 6, and the community. For example, perl.com could really do with a facelift before the big day. Duration: 55 minutes

item.title: Get ready to Party
item.description: This is pretty much the same talk Larry gave at YAPC::Asia, but if you haven't watch that one yet, then watch this one. Duration: 55 minutes.

item.title: War stories: programming in the field of medieval history
item.description: In her keynote, Tara presented her problem domain (aligning multiple editions of manually copied historical documents, to try and identify differences, and the root document) and how she's gone about attacking it with Perl. Duration: 56 minutes

item.title: Q&A with Larry from Swiss Perl Workshop
item.description: At the recent Swiss Perl Workshop, Will "Coke" Coleda had a Q&A with Larry. As you'd expect, it was mainly about Perl 6. Duration: 1 hour

item.title: Imaging effects with Perl
item.description: JT gave a talk on imaging effects in Perl using Imager. Duration: 52 minutes

item.title: Concurrency and Channels in Perl 6
item.description: Aaron continues to share his Perl 6 journey, illustrating concurrency with a simple password cracker script.

item.title: P6SGI: 4 Myths Dispelled
item.description: Sterling addresses some of the confusion and/or grousing that he's perceived related to P6SGI, the Perl 6 analog of PSGI.

item.title: Fluent interfaces in Perl 6
item.description: This started as a short post about Ovid adding a Perl 6 example to the wikipedia page on fluent interfaces. But it became a discussion (in the comments) on what fluent interfaces are all about.

item.title: September 2015 Grant Proposals
item.description: There are 5 grant proposals being considered; four of them are related to RPerl, and the other is to document and release Plerd, a lightweight blogging platform.

item.title: Why Agile Didnâ€™t Work
item.description: Hopefully we all know by now that there are no silver bullets, but that doesn't stop people thinking that an agile development process will solve all of their problems. This is a good discussion of some of the problems experienced by one company on their agile journey.

item.title: Developerâ€™s Guide to Open Source Licenses
item.description: Presents the various characteristics of open source licences that you should be aware of, then goes through the major open sources licences. He makes the point that you should always specify the license for your open source, otherwise people shouldn't use it, and things like Linux distros can't include it.

item.title: That will Showterm
item.description: Yanick demos a nifty service, showterm.io, which will generate a javascript-powered animation of a terminal session. Handy if you want to include a pseudo interactive session showing how to use some command-line tool.

item.title: 11 confounding programming language features
item.description: Eleven features of programming languages that befuddle developers, including two for Perl 5. Before you look: what two features of Perl would you expect to see?

item.title: DBI - Database Independent Interface for Perl
item.description: The beginning of a page about DBI. Now including all the major DBD modules.

item.title: Becoming a co-maintainer of a CPAN-module - the first steps
item.description: The first part of a series mostly on refactoring and improving code.

item.title: Enable Travis-CI for Continous Integration
item.description: A simple Travis-CI configuration file.
